snippet: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, encouraged countries to bolster bank lending and use deregulation to help entrepreneurs.
abstract: European Central Bank president Mario Draghi steps up pressure on countries like Italy to improve climate for business, but says there is room for governments to use public spending to reinvigorate stalled eurozone economy.
lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi, the president of the European Central Bank, encouraged countries to bolster bank lending and use deregulation to help entrepreneurs.

headline.main: Draghi Says Government Spending Could Help Eurozone Economy
headline.print_headline: Draghi Says Government Spending Could Help
